text:
The annual Met Gala held at the Metropolitan Museum Of Art in New York City is happening on Monday.

And several hours before the red carpet got busy, celebrities shared what it was like getting ready for the big fashion event.

This year the theme is Rei Kawakubo/Comme des Garçons and the co-chairs include Katy Perry, Pharrell Williams, Tom Brady, Gisele Bundchen and Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour.

Scroll down for video

Ready to go! Madonna was seen fresh faced as she prepared for the 2017 Met Gala on Monday

What a transformation: He styled do and makeup took years off

Worth the wait: The music personality's efforts paid off as she looked as great as ever

Golden girl: Kate Hudson was covered up in a shiny face mask as she had a towel on her head

Nice look: The Almost Famous star said she was 'off to a good start'

Lemons and McCartney: Kate and Naomi Watts were part of Stella's 'squad' for the evening

Madonna shared a makeup free selfie.

The Rebel Heart singer said she was using a face mask before getting into 'battle dress.'

And what an outfit it was, with the camouflage number sure to be indelibly burned into the memory of anyone unfortunate enough to cast their eyeballs come across it.

Kristin Cavallari was seen in a lace dress that showed off her bra and panties as she headed into a waiting SUV.

Reese Witherspoon shared a bottle of Moet & Chandon champagne that had her name on it and was sent to her hotel room.

Wish you were here Kate? Her former lover Nick Jonas shared a snap of himself in bed

It runs in the family: His brother Joe held a drink as he struck a casual pose next to a window

Loved up: Tom Brady and Gisele Bundchen kissed before co-hosting the event with Katy Perry

Nice backside: Here Gisele showed off the back of her silver gown

So in love these two: Here the model is seen kissing the NFL star's bowtie

Her look on the bed: Here the former catwalk queen shared a shot of her dress and earrings

A-Rod for her back: Jennifer Lopez headed to the event with beau Alex Rodriguez

Visiting the tux shop: The baseball star looked dapper in his trendy tuxedo

Tom Brady and Gisele Bundchen kissed before co-hosting the event with Katy Perry.

First she was seen in a robe.

Then the Vogue cover girl showed off her slinky silver dress which had a very plunging backside.

Mirror, mirror on the wall: Perhaps the Latina lovely quoted the Evil Queen as she eyed up her stunning outfit

A time for reflection: Jennifer will no doubt look back on this outfit with fondness

Fronting up: Busty Candice Swanepoel showcased her famously ample assets

Lovely pair: She was larking about with her professional clotheshorse friend Behatti Prinsloo

Having a ball in bed: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend were in a relaxed mood before the bash

Under the covers story: They risked creasing their clothes by climbing back into bed

Laid back: Kristin Cavallari shared an image as she relaxed in her stunning white dress

Model Taylor Hill was fresh faced as she sat at a bench that had a bottle of Naked juice on it.

The focus will be on the avant-garde designer's technique with silhouettes, draping and fit.

The 74-year-old Japanese fashion legend is the second ever living designer to be the sole subject of the Met's fashion exhibit since Yves Saint Laurent in 1983.

A little plug: Ashley Graham pushed a teeth whitening system as wellas H&M as she sat in her glam room

So many shoes! Halle Berry wore a black dress as she laid on a striped background. The actress captioned the photo: 'Calm before the Met'

Brought to heel: And she accosted on the red carpet by a photo-seeking Nicki Minaj

Show off: She later posted a picture of herself pondering 'how I'm going to get up these stairs'

Before the paint goes on: Model Taylor Hill was fresh faced as she sat at a bench that had a bottle of Naked juice on it

How low can you go? Sofia Richie was a knockout in her metallic gown and long necklace

The glitzy bash, formally known as the Costume Institute Gala, borrows its name from the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the location for the annual NYC event.

In 1946, the gala was launched, in a bid to raise money for the Met’s Costume Institute. This year's lucrative fundraiser will see less that 600 glamorous attendees appear. Tickets market for up to $30,000, while tables cost $275,000.

Guests must be personally approved by American Vogue editor and chairwoman of event, Anna Wintour, with former attendees including Madonna, Anne Hathaway, Rihanna and Kim Kardashian.

Date night: She was joined by a friend and two strapping escorts

Pout and about: She pursed her lips yet again as she posed with another pal

As you do: Lily Collins posted an image of herself relaxing in a bath tub in her dress

Classy: Yolanda Hadid showed off her clutch and heels with a card

New faces: Her sister Bella shared an image of them getting prepared

Too close to call: Bella met her beauty match when she bumped into Celine Dion

Stragglers: They were the final three people to walk the red carpet

Look away now Bella: Her ex The Weeknd and Selena Gomez were flaunting their love

How romantic: The Weeknd posted a snap of them together on the stairs

How dramatic: And she shared a snap of herself on the stair in her gown

Kanye West will be skipping this year's party, according to E! News.

'Kanye will not be attending the Met Gala and will be staying in L.A. with their kids,' a source said.

'He and Kim are doing fine. He has been taking time off and is totally supportive of Kim attending.'

A second source explains that Kanye had planned to go but then decided against it.

Look away now The Weeknd: Fun-loving Selena also cuddled up to an even more handsome gentleman

The many faces of Serena Williams: The pregnant tennis ace looked beside herself with joy

Handsome escort: She was joined by her baby daddy and fiance Alexis Ohanian

Is that a wig? Elizabeth Banks looked different in her pre Met Gala image

Naughty: Karlie Kloss shared a bad girl T-shirt and a photo of her Van Gogh purse

As you do: Katie Holmes casually laughed while hunching over to showcase her cleavage

Beer goggles: The camera was slightly blurry as Katie boasted she and Amy Schumer were 'obviously showing off our cleavage'

'He was planning on attending and recently decided he did not want to go. He and Kim are fine. He will be in Los Angeles.'

Gwyneth Paltrow, who trashed the event for being too crowded several years ago, hinted she would show up at the event.

The Met Gala is a highlight of the fashion calendar.

Diamonds and rust: Classy Kylie Jenner shared a snap of all her jewels for the event

Sister sledge: But no doubt she was jealous when she saw the baubles Kendall had to play with

Her best side: Desperate Kendall showcased her buns as she chatted with Vogue

Anything she can do: The selfie-obsessed star shared a snap of herself in her Versace dress

Birds of a feather: And she later shared a picture of herself with fellow natural beauty Donatella Versace on Snapchat

And with Comme des Garçons designer Rei Kawakuboas named as this year's theme, the famed fund-raiser was always sure to provide plenty of amusing sights.

The Tokyo-based designer has been deemed worthy of the solo focus of this year's gala - which inaugurates the museum's accompanying exhibit of her label.

It is the first time the gala and exhibit has focused on one living designer since 1983, when it highlighted the work of Yves Saint Laurent.

Vogue editor Anna Wintour co-chairs the gala, with the aid of fashion masterminds Katy Perry, Tom Brady, Gisele Bundchen and Pharrell Williams.

Lovely pair: Nicki Minaj posed up with a towering professional clotheshorse before the event

The three beauties: Nicki was a sight as she posed up with the Olsen twins

The three amigos: She later grabbed Ruan Reynolds and Blake Lively for a snap

Skull-crushing it: Cara Delevingne covered her shiny dome with silver paint for the event

Costume Institute curator Andrew Bolton, told AP that Kawakubo is considered the world's 'most important and influential designer' of the moment and 'has consistently defined and re-defined the aesthetics of our time.'

And who can argue with that.

The 74-year-old officially founded her design house in 1973, and was dubbed 'anti-fashion' for supposedly challenging the notions of beauty with her aesthetic.

The Metropolitan Museum in New York - where the annual gala is held - is displaying 120 Comme des Garçons womenswear designs by Kawakubo, spanning the past 35 years, since her first Paris show.

Jumping the shark: It is unlikely many will be impressed with Katy Perry's performance look

Cheeky girl: Her look was more akin to something from the world of professional wrestling

Smoking in the girls' room: It was all kicking off in the toilet in a video Emily Ratatowski shared on Snapchat

Keeping it classy: The women seemed to be having a great time

Gender neutral: Men were smoking in the bathroom as well

Bathroom buddies: Kim Kardashian, Diddy, Bree Olsen and ASAP Rocky were among those who joined Kylie Jenner for her 'annual bathroom selfie'
title: Met Gala 2017: Stars share photos from their glam rooms
